multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been experiencing progressively worsening shortness of breath for the past two months, particularly when I'm active; it doesn't bother me when I'm just resting. I also have a dry cough occasionally.
Have you noticed any swelling in your legs or feet?
No, I have not noticed any swelling in my legs or feet.
Do you have any chest pain or discomfort when walking or exerting yourself?
No, I don't have any chest pain or discomfort when walking or exerting myself.
Have you ever been diagnosed with any heart or lung conditions in the past?
No, I have not been diagnosed with any heart or lung conditions in the past.
Do you have a history of smoking? If yes, for how long?
Yes, I have smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 40 years.
Do you currently take any medications or have any other ongoing health issues?
No, I do not take any medications or have any other ongoing health issues.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 60-year-old man.
**Final Diagnosis:** Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
